review_blob: A stout that even my wife loves!  A thick but not too thick embiance, and flavour surround this drink.  Full bodied filled with chocolate overtones and earthy undertones make this stout a delite for the first time taster.  Exceptionally hard to find outside of larger cities, the east coast of Canada really needs to import this wonderful product!

Despite other ratings, this is a wonderful ale, and highly misjudged.  Drink it room temperature or chilled, it is a fantastic ale to be enjoyed at anytime of year.  Wonderful carmel and wood overtones with earthy after tastes, a really nice lingering aftertaste.  This is one of the true gems from Picaroons.  Its not a barley wine folks, its a winter ale.  Lower then a lot of European strong ales. Picaroons gets it right, if you dont like this, go back to Budwater.

Great beer, its too bad they went into a full scale production with this back in the late 90s, as it wasnt appreciated by the mainstream public.  Its an exceptional blone ale, and it must be stated, that Picaroons is for the beer enthusiast.

Fantastic beer to have by itself or with fish and chips! Try it! Smooth, with a bit of an afterbite.  This is one of Picaroons best, not as heavy as the red, but with enough volume to make your tastebuds happy.
